main

Class GameUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.GameUIController

  • public class GameUIController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls all of the UI elements displayed while in the game scene. I apologize for the sheer size of this class because I know that a lot of the methods could be cut out and maybe placed somewhere else.
    Author:
    Stanton Parham (stparham@ncsu.edu)

      void handleGameCellClicks(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e, boolean tutorialMode)
      Jumps to a cell if it has been double-clicked on; Shows a customized context menu if a cell is right-clicked on;
      void jumpToHotCell(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Immediately centers the view on the hot cell corresponding to which "Hot Cell" button was pressed;
      void jumpToSpacePort(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Immediately centers view on the Space Port;
      void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game by stopping the logic's bgThread and bringing up a pause menu;

      Redraws the previously hovered over cell with its correct color;
      void returnToMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Returns to the main menu by resetting the scene;
      void saveGame()
      Tells the game logic to save the game and depending on if the save is successful or not, this method will append an appropriate message to KAL's chat;

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameUIController

        public GameUIController()
        The constructor that sets the instance field to reference this; THIS SHOULD ACTUALLY NEVER BE USED. IT'S ONLY INCLUDED SO THAT THE instance FIELD WILL BE ABLE TO REFERENCE THE ACTUAL GameUIController OBJECT. THERE SHOULD NEVER BE ANY TIME WHERE THIS CLASS IS USED AS AN ACTUAL OBJECT.

        Pauses the game by stopping the logic's bgThread and bringing up a pause menu;

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Tells the game logic to save the game and depending on if the save is successful or not, this method will append an appropriate message to KAL's chat;

        Changes the view either from "zoomed-in" to "overview" or vice-versa;

        Returns to the main menu by resetting the scene;
        Parameters:
        e - the ActionEvent produced by a button that called this method

      • jumpToSpacePort

        public void jumpToSpacePort(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Immediately centers view on the Space Port;
        Parameters:
        e - an ActionEvent from the button above the map that has the game logo

      • jumpToHotCell

        public void jumpToHotCell(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
        Immediately centers the view on the hot cell corresponding to which "Hot Cell" button was pressed;
        Parameters:
        e - an ActionEvent from one of the three "Hot Cell" buttons above the map;

      • showEndGamePane

        public void showEndGamePane(char option,
                            java.lang.String playerName,
                            java.lang.String difficulty,
                            java.lang.String timeElapsed,
                            int score,
                            int numSoldiers,
                            int numMaterials,
                            int numCores,
                            int numCellsCapped,
                            int numObjsCapped,
                            boolean newHighScore)
        Shows the "game over" screen to the player;
        Parameters:
        option - the type of end game that occurred
        playerName - the player's name
        difficulty - the difficulty of the game
        timeElapsed - the time elapsed while playing the game
        score - the final score for the game
        numSoldiers - the final number of soldiers that the player had
        numMaterials - the final number of materials that the player had
        numCores - the final number of cores that the player had
        numCellsCapped - the overall number of cells that are capped when the game ends
        numObjsCapped - the number of Objectives that are capped when the game ends
        newHighScore - whether or not the player achieved a new high score

      • addHighlight

        public void addHighlight(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Highlights the cell that is currently hovered over with the mouse in orange;
        Parameters:
        e - the MouseEvent

      • removeHighlight

        public void removeHighlight(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Redraws the previously hovered over cell with its correct color;
        Parameters:
        e - the MouseEvent

      • handleGameCellClicks

        public void handleGameCellClicks(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e,
                                 boolean tutorialMode)
        Jumps to a cell if it has been double-clicked on; Shows a customized context menu if a cell is right-clicked on;
        Parameters:
        e - the MouseEvent
        tutorialMode - whether or not the tutorial is taking place (wherever tutorialMode is seen it means that it is needed to ensure that the tutorial does not change the player's resources, captured cells, or other stats before the game even starts)

      • showTutorialPane

        public void showTutorialPane()
        Shows the tutorial pane while pausing the game;
